snippet: The regulations, struck down by a lower court about nine months ago, were intended to remove an exemption in federal minimum wage and overtime laws for home care workers.
abstract: Federal appellate panel in Washington, DC, reinstates Obama administration regulations that extend minimum wage and overtime protections to almost two million home health care workers employed by third-party staffing agencies.
lead_paragraph: The regulations, struck down by a lower court about nine months ago, were intended to remove an exemption in federal minimum wage and overtime laws for home care workers.

headline.main: U.S. Court Reinstates Home Care Pay Rules
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court Reinstates Home Care Pay Rules

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Assn for Home Care and Hospice
